intro: Triplandron, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, while its stems are often hairy as well. Triplandron blooms in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
